subject: AI & Agents
title: Knowledge Cutoff and Real-Time Data
description: A quick win: understand Knowledge Cutoff and Real-Time Data.

hook.text: You ask 'who won the election?' and the model gives last year's answer. It's stuck in the past.

buildup.text: LLMs have a knowledge cutoffâ€”they know nothing after their training data ends.

discovery.text: RAG (retrieval-augmented generation) injects fresh documents into the prompt at runtime.

twist.text: Even with RAG, the model may ignore retrieved context if its prior belief is strong.

climax.text: For time-sensitive apps, always pair the LLM with a live data source and citation check.

punchline.text: Models remember training. RAG remembers today.

quiz.question: How do you give an LLM access to recent information?
